title: Temporary Work (Entertainment) visa (subclass 420)
summary: This page provides information for current holders and sponsors of the Temporary Work (Entertainment) visa (subclass 420), which is closed to new applications. It explains visa validity, obligations for visa holders and their families, and sponsorship requirements and duties.

visa_details.validity: Valid for the duration of the nominated position or two years, whichever is earlier

general_obligations: Comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
Maintain adequate health insurance while in Australia
Leave Australia when the visa ends unless granted another visa
Only engage in work or activities for the employer identified in the nomination
Only engage in work or activities consistent with the nominated position
Request permission from the Entertainment Visa Centre (NSW) for any itinerary changes, including new events, changes in times, or new venues
employment_change_requirements: If the sponsor ceases employment or activity, the holder must find another employer willing to sponsor them (new nomination required, no new visa if existing visa is still valid)
Leave Australia within 28 days or apply for another visa, unless a 'no further stay' condition applies

conditions: Family cannot enter Australia before the primary visa holder
Family must leave Australia when the visa ends
Family must remain members of the family unit
Family must maintain adequate health insurance while in Australia
rights: Family can work or study in Australia while their visa is valid
family_members.additional_conditions_note: Other conditions may apply and will be explained when the visa is granted

reporting_requirements.check_visa_details: Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) can be used for free to check visa details and entitlements

sponsorship_validity.extension: Approved Entertainment sponsors can apply to vary (extend) sponsorship before it expires
sponsorship_validity.expiry_consequence: If sponsorship expires, the sponsor must reapply to be approved before nominating further applicants

requirements: Contact the Entertainment Visa Centre to report any changes that could affect application processing

obligations_list: Provide records and information to the Minister
Notify the department when certain events occur
Not recover, transfer or charge certain costs to another person
Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
Ensure visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity
Secure an offer of reasonable accommodation
sponsorship_obligations.responsibility_note: Sponsors remain responsible for obligations even when authorising another party to act on their behalf

investigation_scope: Whether an illegal worker has been hired

obligation_duration.start: Day sponsorship is approved or work agreement begins
obligation_duration.end: Five years after the sponsorship ends or work agreement ceases

examples_of_cooperation: Producing and providing requested documents within the requested timeframe
Not preventing access to persons with custody of records
Providing officers access to interview any person on premises

requirements: Keep records in a reproducible format
Ensure some records can be independently verified
Keep records of notifications made to the department, including date and method of notification

obligation_duration.end: Two years after sponsor is no longer approved and no longer sponsoring anyone

requirements: Provide requested records or information relating to sponsorship obligations or other matters relevant to administrative action
records_must_include: Records required under Commonwealth, state or territory law
Records required as part of sponsorship obligations

obligation_duration.start: Day sponsorship is approved or work agreement begins
obligation_duration.end: Two years after sponsorship or work agreement ends and the sponsor is no longer sponsoring anyone

requirements: Notify the department in writing by registered post or email within specified timeframes
events_to_report: Primary sponsored person fails to participate in nominated activity
Cessation of participation in a film or television production
Early cessation of work prior to the approved nomination cessation date (except performers in film/television)
Sponsor ceases to hold a required licence
Changes to sponsorâ€™s address or contact details
If the sponsor is an Australian organisation, the legal entity ceases to exist

obligation_duration.start: Day standard business sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
obligation_duration.end: Two years after sponsorship or work agreement ends and no individuals are being sponsored

postal_addresses.address: Sponsor Monitoring, GPO Box 717, Canberra ACT 2601
Sponsor Monitoring, GPO Box 9984, Sydney NSW 2001
